poem:
"A Tracery in Grain and Stone"

The chisel's voice is stilled —
Harry, artisan of grain and stone,
life's engraving sketch complete.
An echo in Bath's workshop lingers,
Castletown Cox whispers your name.
A testament in tendered waters,
sedulous hand in patience drawn.
Your legacy, not in cold award,
but in the soul of stone awakened.
Rest, dear friend,
now the sculpture of silence.
